Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian pottery Ionian cup with everted rim; white slip; interior glazed (fired red) with added white band below junction with body; exterior: rim glazed, reserved below.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For a parallel regarding the rim shape, see Boardman, J., Excavations in Chios 1952-1955. Greek Emporio. Annual of the British School at Athens Supplement 6. Oxford 1967, 171, no. 864, fig. 118. Probably from same cup as British Museum 1965,0930.400 and 400a and Boston, MFA 1888.1081 (or Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR.323.1899)
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1918) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
